N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2370.2 - Designation and duties of the records access officer

State Regulations

The Commissioner of Taxation and Finance, who is also the

President of the State Tax Commission, shall designate a "records access
officer" who shall perform the following duties: (a) The records access officer shall have the
duty of coordinating the department's response to public requests for access to
its records. (b) He shall provide
information concerning the nature and location of records; maintain a current
list of records indexed according to subject matter for public inspection; respond to all inquiries relating to the availability to the public of the
department's records pursuant to the Freedom of Information Law with due
regard, however, upon all occasions enumerated in this Part to the secrecy
provisions embodied in the Tax Law. (c) He shall receive and process requests for
access to records in the manner prescribed by this Part. (d) He shall receive and process request for
the copying of records in the manner prescribed by this Part. (e) He shall make available the forms
prescribed in section
2370.5
of this Part and such other forms he deems necessary for access to
records. (f) He shall have
responsibility for the safekeeping of records under inspection. (g) He shall have the cooperation and
assistance of all personnel of the department in the performance of his
functions under this Part. (h) He
shall designate one or more members of the department, as he deems necessary, to serve as assistant records access officer and such assistant or assistants
in all department offices shall have only those functions and responsibilities
which are expressly delegated to such assistant or assistants by the records
access officer. (i) He shall charge
and receive for the copying or inspection of records the fee prescribed by this

Part. Notes
